snippet: The United States and the United Nations announced the 72-hour pause early Friday, a diplomatic bolt-from-the-blue that will set the stage for arduous negotiations between Israel and Hamas.
abstract: United States and United Nations announce 72-hour humanitarian cease-fire in Gaza conflict; suspension of bloody 24-day military campaign sets the stage for arduous negotiations between Israel and Hamas; announcement comes with no warning but appears to be more significant than shorter cease-fire that fell apart.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from New Delhi, and Mark Landler from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Jodi Rudoren and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem, Fares Akram from Gaza, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United States and the United Nations announced the 72-hour pause early Friday, a diplomatic bolt-from-the-blue that will set the stage for arduous negotiations between Israel and Hamas.

headline.sub: Israeli Troops Will Remain in Place
headline.main: Cease-Fire in Gaza Conflict Takes Effect as Talks Are Set
headline.print_headline: A 72-Hour Pause in Gaza Conflict as Talks Are Set
